title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to halt the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while a court case is ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft announced that in its latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, it will remove a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection and logging into a Microsoft account.
summary: Microsoft has announced that the new Windows 11 Insider Preview will no longer include a script that permitted users to set up their devices without an internet connection or a Microsoft account.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will last until Monday, March 31st. The sale features dozens of deals accessible to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, and there is also a focus on providing low-cost alternatives for shoppers.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is ongoing until March 31st, offering dozens of deals to all customers, not limited to Prime members. The sale includes a roundup of over 100 deals on popular items, with an emphasis on affordable alternatives for shoppers.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk, who bought Twitter for $44 billion years earlier, now values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. Previously, Musk acquired Twitter for $44 billion. Currently, xAI is valued at $80 billion, and X is valued at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion of debt.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that fail to boot. This feature was first announced last year, following the Crowdstrike incident, to enhance device recovery processes.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature, designed for IT professionals, allows for the remote recovery of devices that fail to boot. It was announced last year after the Crowdstrike incident to improve device recovery methods.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This update follows the company's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021 and subsequent integration of Fitbit’s services with Google's.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to transfer their accounts to Google accounts to next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. This move is part of the integration process of Fitbit’s services with Google's.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time

summary: The Metals Company (TMC), focused on starting deep-sea mining, sought to strengthen its relationship with the Trump administration after facing challenges in international discussions. Supported by Nauru, TMC intensified its push for mining regulations in 2021.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'
snippets: Researchers have developed a growth factor cocktail that reversed fatal cell damage in mice exposed to anthrax. This finding suggests the potential for adapting this method to treat anthrax infections in humans.
summary: Researchers have created a growth factor cocktail that successfully reversed fatal cell damage in mice exposed to anthrax. This breakthrough indicates a possibility of adapting the treatment for anthrax infections in humans.

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have created a new model using AI and machine learning to better predict chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model combines whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analysis, improving accuracy beyond previous methods that relied on only one type of data.
summary: Researchers developed an AI and machine learning model that more accurately predicts chemotherapy results for muscle-invasive bladder cancer by combining whole-slide tumor images with gene expression analysis. This approach surpasses older methods that used only one data type.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a direct link between dopamine levels and cognitive flexibility, finding that increased dopamine production in the brain during challenging tasks leads to more efficient task completion. This breakthrough, revealed through PET imaging, could lead to improved treatment methods for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Scientists have found a direct connection between dopamine levels in the brain and cognitive flexibility, showing that higher dopamine production during difficult tasks results in more efficient completion of those tasks. This discovery, made using PET imaging, may enhance treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. This insight could help in understanding how latency works in other nervous system infections.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can recognize and control the inactive stage of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. This discovery could improve understanding of latency in various nervous system infections.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers are key factors in determining why some plants thrive in certain regions but not in others. This research sheds light on how plant distributions have evolved over millions of years, emphasizing the influence of specific regional factors on global plant diversity.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species revealed that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers significantly influence why certain plants prosper in specific regions. This research highlights how plant distributions have evolved over millions of years, focusing on the impact of regional factors on worldwide plant diversity.
